1. Office of the Mayor

Office of the Mayor
===================

Mayor Frank Ritchie
-------------------

Elected in the May 2023 General Election, Mayor Ritchie and his family have called Boerne home for many years. He is heavily involved in the community in addition to being a business owner and a local pastor.

### Mayor's Responsibilities

The Boerne mayor is elected at large by Boerne residents and serves a two-year term with no term limits. The mayor is the presiding officer of the
[City Council](https://www.ci.boerne.tx.us/77 "City Council")
. The mayor is recognized as head of the City government for all ceremonial purposes and by the governor for purposes of military law. The mayor may debate and discuss any matters before the council but only votes in the event of a tie. When authorized by the council, the mayor signs all official documents. The mayor appoints, with the advice and consent of the council, the members of citizen advisory boards and commissions.

### Contacting the Mayor

The mayor meets with citizens and community groups by appointment only.
[Email Mayor Ritchie](mailto:fritchie@boerne-tx.gov)
your questions and concerns directly or to schedule an appointment.

The mayor issues proclamations and other ceremonial documents to congratulate, honor, or recognize a City of Boerne resident or organization. These documents include:

Ceremonial documents are reserved for people, places or events that positively contribute to the economic, social, and/or cultural fabric of the City of Boerne.

Mayor's Blog
------------

Mayor Ritchie posts on his blog to keep residents informed of local government business, as well as inspiring and collaborative happenings in our community.
